description: A compact ultrasonic distance sensor module capable of measuring distances from 2 cm to 400 cm with an accuracy of 3 mm. It includes an ultrasonic transmitter, receiver, and control circuitry. The module operates on a 5 V supply and uses a 10 µs TTL trigger pulse to initiate ranging, returning a TTL echo pulse whose width is proportional to the measured distance.

other: Echo output: TTL pulse width proportional to distance

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to 5 V, GND to ground, Trig to a microcontroller digital pin, and Echo to another digital pin. Ensure GND is connected before VCC to avoid malfunction.

example_code.explaination: This Arduino sketch triggers the HC‑SR04, measures the echo pulse width, converts it to distance in centimeters, and prints the result to the serial monitor.
